description:
This resource provides the Exadata Infrastructure resource in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Database service.

Create Exadata infrastructure.

tfcfnid.description: Internal identifier for tracking resource changes. Do not use.

ActivationFile.description: The activation zip file. If provided in config, exadata infrastructure will be activated after creation. Updates are not allowed on activated exadata infrastructure.

AdminNetworkCidr.description: (Updatable) The CIDR block for the Exadata administration network.

CloudControlPlaneServer1.description: (Updatable) The IP address for the first control plane server.

CloudControlPlaneServer2.description: (Updatable) The IP address for the second control plane server.

CorporateProxy.description: (Updatable) The corporate network proxy for access to the control plane network. Oracle recommends using an HTTPS proxy when possible for enhanced security.

DefinedTags.description: (Updatable) Defined tags for this resource. Each key is predefined and scoped to a namespace. For more information, see [Resource Tags](https://docs.cloud.oracle.com/iaas/Content/General/Concepts/resourcetags.htm).

DisplayName.description: The user-friendly name for the Exadata infrastructure. The name does not need to be unique.

DnsServer.description: (Updatable) The list of DNS server IP addresses. Maximum of 3 allowed.

FreeformTags.description: (Updatable) Free-form tags for this resource. Each tag is a simple key-value pair with no predefined name, type, or namespace. For more information, see [Resource Tags](https://docs.cloud.oracle.com/iaas/Content/General/Concepts/resourcetags.htm).  Example: `{"Department": "Finance"}`.

Gateway.description: (Updatable) The gateway for the control plane network.

InfiniBandNetworkCidr.description: (Updatable) The CIDR block for the Exadata InfiniBand interconnect.

Netmask.description: (Updatable) The netmask for the control plane network.

NtpServer.description: (Updatable) The list of NTP server IP addresses. Maximum of 3 allowed.

Shape.description: The shape of the Exadata infrastructure. The shape determines the amount of CPU, storage, and memory resources allocated to the instance.

TimeZone.description: (Updatable) The time zone of the Exadata infrastructure. For details, see [Exadata Infrastructure Time Zones](https://docs.cloud.oracle.com/iaas/Content/Database/References/timezones.htm).
